label: A2BCD4_tP8_123_h_b_a_eg-001
title: HgBa$_{2}$CuO$_{4}$ (Hg-1201) Structure
comments:
The Hg-$12(n-1)n$, or $n$HBCCO in the notation of (Bacq-Labreuil, 2024), cuprates have the general formula HgBa$_{2}$Ca$_{n-1}$Cu$_{n}$O$_{2n+2+\delta}$. These are tetragonally-stacked perovskite-like compounds similar to \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B3C8D_tP14_123_h_bg_egi_c-001}{tetragonal YBa$_{2}$Cu$_{3}$O$_{7}-x$}, and all are superconducting at temperatures near or above 100K.  Although compounds have been structured for $n \le 16$ (Bacq-Labreuil, 2024) we will limit ourselves to tabluating the first three.  In addition, we will only list the zero-pressure structures and assume perfect stoiciometry.  In practice the can be additional oxygen ($\delta > 0$) and a deficit of barium. 
 We include the structures \begin{itemize} \item Hg1201/1HBCCO: \href{current_web_home_dir/A2BCD4_tP8_123_h_b_a_eg-001}{HgBa$_{2}$CuO$_{4}$} (this structure), \item Hg1212/2HBCCO: \href{current_web_home_dir/A2BC2DE6_tP12_123_h_c_g_b_gi-001}{HgBa$_{2}$CaCu$_{2}$O$_{6}$}, and \item Hg1223/3HBCCO: \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B2C3DE8_tP16_123_h_h_bg_a_egi-001}{HgBa$_{2}$Ca$_{2}$Cu$_{3}$O$_{8}$} \end{itemize}
